intro: Ruellia pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Ruellia pittieri is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
